current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To promote the non-exclusive use of electronic labeling for devices licensed by the Federal
			 Communications Commission.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

text.#text:
As devices become smaller, compliance with physical label requirements can become more difficult
			 and

labeling information digitally on the screen of the

text.#text:
Many manufacturers and consumers of licensed devices in the United States would prefer to have the

An electronic labeling option would give flexibility to manufacturers

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Title VII of the Communications Act of 1934

header.#text: Authorization for Federal Communications Commission to allow electronic labeling
Optional electronic labeling of communications equipment

term.#tail: means displaying required labeling and regulatory information electronically; and
means any equipment or device that—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
before the
			 equipment or
			 device may be marketed or sold within the United States; and

text.#text: is required under regulations of the
has the capability to digitally display required labeling and regulatory information.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Enhance Labeling, Accessing, and Branding of Electronic Licenses Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Enhance Labeling, Accessing, and Branding of Electronic Licenses Act of 2014

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall promulgate regulations or take other appropriate action, as necessary, to
			 allow manufacturers of radiofrequency devices with display the option to
			 use electronic
			 labeling for the equipment in place of affixing physical
			 labels to the equipment.

text.#text: Not later than 9 months after the date of enactment of the

header.#text: Requirement To promulgate regulations for electronic labeling
